page.title: 18SAFETY ASPECTS LOWER PENARTH
page.content: Class 9,Evenlode school walked a part of Penarth observing{safety features. We asked questions at the{fire station There is 1 engine and a landrover.This station has an average of 2 calls per day and 600 calls per year.7 firemen are always on duty and 5 men go on the engine answering 999 calls.The station serves{Penarth,Sully,Dinas Powis and Llandough.We counted safety features, {fire hydrants,drains,stop taps and {street}lamps.Rain water runs from the camber to the gutter and drains away. We counted{46 drains}in about 1 mile. Lamp posts are helpful to pedestrians, when it is dark,the lights are turned on.We noticed{11 fire hydrants}where firemen connect the{hoses.Water stop- {taps}are important.39manholes,elec.and gas inspection covers were seen.9road signs were counted.Many houses had {burglar alarms}fitted externally.
